comment.description: We need to establish a differential criterion for the usage of event and activity (albeit one of infinitesimal duration). The definition of event includes planned and actual dates. This implies there is no strong distinction between type definitions and occurrences, and that the data in the event entity changes over time. The management of such change is more complex in a distributed system. It may be better to write event out of PLCS altogether and simply use activity. Besides which, activity connects up to all the right places, whereas once we start with event, then we will end up committing to more and more extensions. See my earlier e-mails on usage guidance for event and then guess whether it is likely to be consistently implemented.
Event is included for compatability with the PDM schema

description.p: Many of the modules in the ballot depend on the Application Module classification_assignment (1114). However, the definition of the Classification_assignment ARM entity is not clear in respect of the meaning of the role attribute: "A Classification_assignment is the assignment of a Class to product or activity data for their classification.

role: specifies the meaning of the relationship between the assigned_class and the associated items. The value of this attribute need not be specified. In the case where it is not specified, the meaning of the assignment is that every member of items belongs to the assigned_class.

EXAMPLE 2 The role for 'environmental conditions' has the associated object that is a classification that categorizes the classified element in respect of its ability to comply with environmental impact requirements."

The example does not help to illustrate the meaning of a non blank role attribute. The fundamental question is what is "classification" other than identifying members of a class (which is the default for role when empty)?

comment.description: This has been raised as a SEDS (879) against classification_assignment (1114). Is the proposal to change the examples to show the case where the role attribute is required?

description.p: This section makes no reference to View_definition_context, which has two attributes that are prime candidates for refrence data of suitability to AP239. These attributes are: "application_domain" and "life_cycle_stage".

The generic value of "application_domain" for AP239 would appear to be "product life cycle support". "logistic support analysis" also comes to mind but there are others. Prime candidates for "life_cycle_stage" would come from the UK MoD CADMID cycle, that is "concept", "assessment", "demonstration", "manufacture", "in service" and "disposal".

description.p: Some of the modules in the ballot depend on the Application Module attribute_classification (1246). However, the definition of the Attribute_classification ARM entity is not clear: "An Attribute_classification is an assertion that an attribute on an instance of an EXPRESS entity is a member of a Class.".

An attribute being a member is an ambiguous concept. An entity represents some real world object (concept) and this object being a member of a class seems obvious. Is it the attribute value that is a member of the allowed_value? (There appear to be three other interpretations). Furthermore, if this is the case then what is the allowed_value? The id or name of the external class (either of which cause potential problems in respect of identity, multi lingualism)? Something else? In which case, the concept of attribute classification appears somewhat weak.
